p: We first attempted to obtain a deposition of a ZnO thin layer on a tortuous AC substrate at various temperatures. Figure 2a depicts XRD results of ALD ZnO deposition at 120 °C using 100 ms pulse time for DEZ. With an increase in the ALD cycles from 2 to 6, one can see in the 2θ spectrum no ZnO peak formation, except the carbon and aluminum substrate peaks. Increasing the number of ALD cycles to 20 results in a broad XRD signal between 30 and 40 degrees, indicating ZnO’s appearance, as shown in Figure 2b. Yet, the deposited material does not grow into the crystalline ZnO phase, using the same pulsing time (100 ms).
